Batch action
When a business process involves running multiple actions in a row, set up a
Batch action
.
The
Batch action
arranges the sequential launch of the actions configured previously. Learn more about
custom actions
, how
to set them
and
create new ones
(if required).
To configure a batch action:
1. Go to the action registry (
Learn more about working with the registry
), and create a new action. The System will display a profile to configure a custom action.
2. Specify the required settings for the
Action
. The following are the basic settings for the action considered. Other (general) action settings are given in
here
.
Setting
Purpose
Name
Enter the setting name, for example,
Send to all examinations
.
User Interface Module
Select the User Interface Module
Batch action
.
Action type
Confirm the display of the button â€“ select the
Action
value.
Additional action parameters
Define actions to be performed sequentially. Considered below (see point 3).
Object types
Select the object type the action is configured for.
3. Select the list of actions to be performed sequentially as an additional parameter. The sequence of actions is defined by their order.
4. Save.
The settings saved will allow users to perform the actions one by one. For example, click just one button to send an application for decision-making for an expert examination. And this action (batch action) will start the sequential execution of each batch examination.
